definition: lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)

sentences.english: Napoleon planned to strike a quick blow at his old enemy.
sentences.chinese: 拿破伦策划对他的宿敌实施迅雷不及掩耳的打击。

sentences.english: She is so quick and will try to put her food into my mouth.
sentences.chinese: 她试着迅雷不及掩耳把自己的食物放到我的嘴里。

sentences.english: So I can make believe I have everything.
sentences.chinese: 纵然我可以掩耳盗铃的以为自己拥有了一切。

sentences.english: They will turn their ears away from the truth and turnaside to myths.
sentences.chinese: 并且掩耳不听真道，偏向荒渺的言语。

sentences.english: Flagship corporations collapsing in the blink of an eye.
sentences.chinese: 大公司在迅雷不及掩耳的情况下一一倒塌。

sentences.english: The company said in a statement that Ms Bartz was removed by the board of directors, effective immediately.
sentences.chinese: 而公司董事会的这一决定更是掩耳不及迅雷之速。

sentences.english: Ungrateful people are actually cheating themselves, scientists believe.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们以为，不知感恩的人理论上是掩耳盗铃。

sentences.english: And they will abandon the truth to hear fables.
sentences.chinese: 且掩耳不听真理，偏去听那无稽的传说。

sentences.english: Coph. Thou hast heard my voice: turn not away thy ear from my sighs, and cries.
sentences.chinese: 你曾俯听过我的呼声，对我的哀祷，不要掩耳不闻。

sentences.english: Mikazuki is traversing across the bamboo forest at lightning speed.
sentences.chinese: 三日月以迅雷不及掩耳的速度穿越竹林。

sentences.english: You nosl do not stay; I for soon for more why a self-deception for soon for more.
sentences.chinese: 迩终究没有一句挽留，我又何必再掩耳盗铃。

sentences.english: The public security men drove straight to the bandits' den with the suddenness of thunder bolt.
sentences.chinese: 公安人员以迅雷不及掩耳之势直捣匪巢。

sentences.english: This country 's economy has been developing at breakneck speed.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的经济以迅雷不及掩耳的速度发展起来。

definition: to seize an opportunity/to exploit (a loophole)
to jump out of the way
to get out of the way
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
